column4: I am trying to install emacs and I followed the instructions ('cd' to the directory, then './configure',) but then it couldn't find gcc or cc and it gave me the error "configure: error: no acceptable cc found in $PATH".
i think emacs is installed by default (i maybe be wrong); if not, you can install it from synaptic
you can install emacs from synaptic, or using apt-get
emacs is on the ubuntu install CD -- or you can install it off the net
